intro: Bejaria denticulata, commonly known as the toothed bejaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid climates. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom during the rainy season. Bejaria denticulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
